results.title: The Trouble with boys
results.brief_description: Concern is increasing that boys are not coping with traditional schooling, and growing up in general. Alarm is centred around poor literacy and behaviour, health and welfare problems, and a tendency towards alienation and aggression in boys and young men. the program looks at the problems of differences in academic achievement between boys and girls, decline of interest in reading amongst boys, effects of unemployment and changing male roles, differing problems fro boys growing up in the country and the city. Also illustrated are some examples of how some schools are dealing with these issues. Study guide included.

results.title: The Trouble with Archie
results.brief_description: A dramatisation about a supervisor who learns to handle an employee who is always getting into trouble showing that the supervisor is firm and that at the same time he gives the employee a sense of responsibility.

results.title: The Troop grows
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: This film is not intended for public promotional purposes, but is aimed at the Scoutmaster, in the belief that he is the key to a successful recruiting program. The film serves as an introduction, telling the story of how one scoutmaster solved his particular problems, discovering that they were tied up together with good program and boy leadership.

results.title: The Trombone
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Muir Mathieson, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids, World Mirror-Realist Films and Anvil Film and Recording Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”
Alfred Flaszynski describes the history of the trombone, its development and the technique of playing, illustrated by excerpts from Ravel’s Bolero and George Lohmann’s Posaune Teufel. The problems of selecting each note by the correct use of the slide and the appropriate harmonic series are dealt with in detail.

results.title: The Trojan women
results.brief_description: A joint Greek and American production based on Euripedes’ play “The Trojan women”. Katharine Hepburn is Hecube, the wife of King Priam; Vanessa Redgrave is Andromache, the widow of Hector; Genevieve Bujold is Cassandra, the cursed prophetess of Apollo and Trojan Princess and Irene Papas is the beautiful Helen of Troy. The victors of the Trojan war ransack the city and take as part of their spoils, the women and children. The play tells of their bitter struggle to survive the cruelty of defeat and capture.
results.description: A joint Greek and American production based on Euripedes’ play “The Trojan women”. Katharine Hepburn is Hecube, the wife of King Priam; Vanessa Redgrave is Andromache, the widow of Hector; Genevieve Bujold is Cassandra, the cursed prophetess of Apollo and Trojan Princess and Irene Papas is the beautiful Helen of Troy. The victors of the Trojan war ransack the city and take as part of their spoils, the women and children. The play tells of their bitter struggle to survive the cruelty of defeat and capture.

results.title: The Triple jump
results.creator_credit: Dr Frank Ryan and Ryan Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”
The technique of the triple jump, sometimes known as the hop, step and jump, is shown in normal and slow motion speeds. Training and preparation techniques for achieving success in this event from the beginner stage are also shown.

results.title: The Trip (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Louie is lonely when he moves out of his neighbourhood - so he constructs an imaginary world in a shoe box and flies off in his toy plane to visit old friends. The adventure helps Louie discover that friends are friends wherever you are. Based on the book by Ezra Jack Keats. Narrated by Charles Turner.
